review: It's Chili's not the best but not the worst. Restroom was filthy and service was slow.

Where to begin? I met some girl friends there with my children. They were already seated when we arrived. Once we were seated, our waiter came to take our drink orders. He was a young guy. Hey, I was a teenager when I started waitressing as well so no biggie. BUT, he turned out to be very incompetent and just had no clue. My 2 friends ordered salads with their meals- they came out the same time as the entree. It's already a full table with all of us so this left very little room on the table top. He would place full dishes directly in front of my grabby 8-month old with no regard to hot plates or what have you. Okay, some people don't know, that's fine. I just whisked them out of harm's way. But why are you continuing to do so?? He got my kid's meal order wrong, but as he was already hungry at that point, I didn't make a fuss with it. He got my order wrong, which I did ask him to correct. I had ordered the original chicken crispers with sweet potato fries. (At the time I was ordering I asked if the sweet potato fries could be substituted for the regular. He replied that that shouldn't be a problem.) I mean, if I'm going to pay all this extra money for a dish, I expect to get what I want. I feel the same way towards my own customers. You should be satisfied. Well, we got through the meal. I had to flag other servers down for water re-fills, boxes that I had already asked for, and extra bags because 1 bag for multiple people going in separate directions really won't work that well. In addition, I placed a to-go order. Again, these were placed directly in front of the children where some of the containers were knocked over.  The checks-- he split the checks appropriately, though it really took far too long to bring them. My very patient friend got exasperated at this point. Once I reviewed my check I saw a charge for an add-on item.  I questioned the waiter what that was about. He said for the parmesan fries. Parmesan fries? Who had that? Well, you did. Umm, no I didn't. You mean the sweet potato fries? Oh yea, uhh, yea that was it. Ok, but I asked if it would be ok and you said it shouldn't be a problem? Then this kid says, Oh I think I said I'd go check and come back and let you know. There is an additional fee. Ummmm, no. You never came back to tell me, when I asked you said it shouldn't be a problem, so could you please go remove that, thank you. He ended up taking it off. Now, this kid is obviously not that efficient. Fine, maybe it's a first job. Never ONCE did any member of management come over to check on our table after ALL THESE ISSUES! I have never worked at a restaurant where a manager didn't at least try to follow up with something like this, even if it was just a simple apology. SO, we all closed our checks. I will not be calling in to the stupid customer satisfaction survey number just so I can get a discount code for my next visit because I promise you, THERE WILL BE NO NEXT VISIT!!

From walking in I knew I should have sat at the bar. Though doubt that would have made things better.  I waited 37 minutes for an appetizer, while the table next to me say 20 minutes after I did for their appetizer and meal before I got my single half order or Fries.  Then once my meal arrived, 45 minutes after being sat down, it was incorrect. Had to send it back and explain my order twice more before he understood the order.  The food was not the cause of the rating, but the lack of service and obvious inconsistency of wait staff and training.  This not my normal area of Houston but I have had far better service at many other Chili's restaurants. As a former waiter, 5 years in 4 star establishment, I know what it takes to provide acceptable service and spectacular service. This comes no where near reasonable or  acceptable. Step it up guys.
Waited 20 minutes to be seated and then they sat my husband and I in the middle of a group party area. Table was not cleaned and service sucked.

Sat at the bar where I belong, however did not feel at home. The bartender was obviously new to the trade- it was still daylight outside and he was flustered and forgetful. He served me with a smile, yet still slow, even at getting the check lol. Nonetheless, date settled on a beer because the bar wasn't stocked with any of the 4 drinks requested. Either that or the bartender just had no clue. With a plate of ribs and mash potatoes with corn. Looked pretty good. I had a glass of the house wine, with buffalo chicken salad and was content when I finally left outta there.

Worst service ever! We were seated in the bar area and it was not crowded. The bartender took our order quickly but seemed agitated. It took 20 minutes to get a glass of water and even longer to get the appetizer. I was on an hour lunch break and had to leave before my dish even came. I asked to speak to the manager and he was so flustered and did not try to accommodate us at all. Do not go here!

I went to this filthy place on October 22 around 3 pm. This was way after any lunch crowd.  I notified management and she tried to blame the waitresses area. The waitress 30 min a day of data til Friday to put it on the previous customer afer he stood up. To top off the dirty floors All over, the food was not hot and it was over cooked.  I will stick to my cleaner site in Missouri City/Sugarland TX.

I've been to the Chilli's restaurant many times and I really don't have much negative or positive to say about the restaurant. We were in the area and decided to go by this particular location on our way back to back home. I really wasn't going to do a review until I noticed the restaurant on have (1) star and I also remembered how attentive and quick our waiter was. I can't take away for the experience that others had here but all I can say is that our service was great and food was good as well!

If possible I would give them no stars for their bad customer service. They have the dumbest policy that you can't split a check when it's 7 or more. It is not my fault that other customers have walked out on them. Later that night I realized why ppl would dine and dash and it's because their service is horrible. It took exactly one hr and 14 min to get my COLD triple dipper. Not only that but my drink never made it to my hands. They should change their whole staff including management asap before they loose more customers.

I went in last night to place a to-go order.  First they had a very inexperienced person working on a Friday night. She was not very informative with the menu selection. The others person Jamie was very unconcerned with customer service.  I was not happy that it took over 30 minutes for me to receive my order. In the future I will just drive to another location if I want a to go order.

I am never returning to this place again! The service is horrible! And they move like turtles! We ordered 2 appetizers and the fries came out first and then they brought out my dip right before the food!!! Who does that? Then we got the food and they forgot the garlic bread. They kept saying it's coming...it came and we were done with the food. Their excuse was the kitchen is backed up. If you need a job please come up here and help. They need it bad! They even cut off a whole section cause they are under staffed. I will continue to go to the Chillis in Sugar Land, Tx
Wonderful experience. Tasha was wonderful. Food was great and it came out fast. Loved the bacon burger and onion rings!

This is my local Chili's and have been here a few times. After seeing this I'm a little disgusted to this I just had a margarita and it came from one of these containers of the sweet and sour mix! YUCK! A little bleach over night soak and clean these up!

I've been to this Chili's quite often for lunch, as it is the best table service option near work.  It has always satisfied.  The service is always fine to great, and the food is good (for Chili's chain restaurant type food).  They have a lot of affordable lunch special options that are plenty of food. I've never had an amazing experience, but I have also never had a bad experience.  It is really a very good option for my needs and I am sure I will be back for another work lunch soon.  This place is the epitome of A-OK dining in my opinion.
This is the dirtiest restraunt I've ever been in I've been here 2 times every table was dirty they just stand around please don't eat here

##1 STAR## I've never seen a chilis like this one. This location was a dump, we start off by the host asking us to be seated and in between that a customer leaving asked for a bag. She left us to go to the back to get him a bag and then came back and seated us. The table next to us was dirty with a wet rag on on the floor. The hostess said our server would be with us shortly but they never showed after 10 min. If your hungry and in the area don't bother stopping here.

First, I'll admit that I never actually ate here, but not for the lack of trying. I was headed home from downtown and wanted to grab some to-go for my family. However, they wouldn't answer the phone, but I still stopped by to see if I could get something in a reasonable amount of time. Once there, I notice their phone was ringing but being ignored. I asked the girl if they answer their phone and she said they were too busy. I mentioned that I had been trying to call for 15 minutes; she shrugged her shoulders and asked if I was going to order. I asked how long it would take, and she said 25 minutes. I said no thanks. She didn't say anything. Why would anybody chose to patronize a place that treats you like that? If they are too busy for my business, then they can go on without it.

This is my local Chili's, but I'm not sure why I keep going there.  I'm either stupid, or I think they'll get better, I guess. The food is tasty, and the service is decent, but the restaurant itself isn't great.  The last time I went, I was seated in the "lounge", and I ended up staring at a table with a bus tub full of dirty dishes (that continued to grow) all night. Maybe this location suffers from poor management? I don't know. I just think something needs to change, besides the interior decorations and menu.

I chose to visit this location on a Thursday evening around 7 pm. Upon my arrival they had a crowd of maybe 5 tables, but neglected to sit my party of two. Overall, I would rate their customer service very low.

This place is horrible.  The food sucks and they won't refund your money.  The manager was not helpful at all (Rod).  Not willing to give refund due to new policy.  This place should get a zero. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME COMING HER THIS PLACE SUCKS.  IF I COULD GIVE IT A ZERO, I WOULD.  RODRICK SCOTT you need to work on your customer service.  DO NOT COME TO THIS PLACE TO EAT....
Waited for 10 minutes and not one person came serve us. Ended up leaving. Would give zero stars

This Chili's is probably the worst Chili's you could eat at.  My husband and I, had said we wouldn't go back but since its so close to home we would somehow end up settling for it.  Until this last time we went,  when we vowed we'd never to go back! We waited 20 minutes for drinks, during that time we were trying to decide if it'd be best to just eat somewhere else. As we were about to get up and leave the waitress came with the drinks.  We told her politely we waited a while for our drinks and didn't feel like staying anymore and we'd more than glady pay our drinks. Her whole demeanor changed and she got very snappy. She said,  "Whatever,  you didn't wait 20min but you can go". I stayed in Aw and asked to speak to the manager, he came apologized and said drinks were on him and he was extremely sorry for the inconvenience as far as the wait and her attitude.  And ever since we have not gone back.  Key points:   They take forever.  Its not very clean.  They don't have very good customer service.

This was the dirtiest restaurant I have ever stepped into. Makes me wonder what the kitchen may have looked like.  It is a shame because the waitress was so nice. What was sad was the place was not even busy. There might of been ten tables full, however 10 other tables we dirty with plates on them. The bar was even loaded with dirty glasses. Hopefully things here will get better, however I probably won't go back.

This is my first 1 star review. The time was about 3pm on a Friday.  The place was about half full, it took waiting 15 minutes before I just walked up to the bartender and he had to come from behind the bar and seat me. The waitress was ok, her section was to large. It took another 25 minutes for the food to come out. Again, it wasn't busy. They were definitely understaffed,  until it was time to sing happy bday. Everyone employee showed up clapping.
Bad customer service!  If you want to wait and wait. ..and keep on waiting....this is the chillis for you!
Best Golden Corral ever! Awesome service and the selections of food is amazing. Something for everyone.

I'm normally a fan of Chili's, But this location is pretty horrible.  I just left and I had to get a drink to go to try to wash out the freezer burned food taste of my mouth. If you're looking for work please apply for the management position because obviously they're not doing their job.

I only give this place a star because I needed a pop of color on this grey ass page. This place is the all kinds of wrong. It smells like old carpet in a drug house. The staff is inattentive and uninterested. The bartender ignored me purposely I literally had to yell excuse me I would like to order. The lady pretended to ignore me. Until another employee bumped her shoulder. The management should really think about re-training this group of employees. Their attitudes were disgraceful. Since the bartender would not give me her name, let me add a small description: Brown skin Lady (Kinda boyish) Long dreads Petite

Absolute worst experience I have ever had here. Let me start off by saying I usually have great customer service here,however this was not the case today I sat at the bar and was completely ignoreI wasn't greeted when I walked in. After sitting for maybe 15 or 20 minutes I was finally asked "do I know what I want", after ordering I waited another 30 minutes and still no food mind you I ordered a club sandwich. my server "Jasmine" never even put the order in it took the next bartender to put my order in so I had to wait another 15 minutes for club sandwich.

This was the WORST experience!! From beginning  to end was terrible. I walked in and the hostess didn't greet me she just informed me there was a 30 min wait time. I agreed to stay and wait. I asked for a table in the bar area and the hostess replied back with "the tables are dirty" so I asked her to clear one of the smaller tables off  and she just looked at me! I serve the public daily and often I have to step outside of my job duties to help customers and co-workers. The hostess doesn't understand that concept apparently!!  I was finally given a table in the main dining area and my waitress was HORRIBLE! No greeting other than " what do you want to drink?' I gave my order and had to ask for a straw, silverware, the correct dressing I ordered with my salad, a to-go container twice and my ticket!! NEVER Again will I eat here. I paid with cash and I didn't receive a receipt. I called the general manger Rodgerick the next morning and he seemed so unconcerned about my HORRIBLE experience at his facility. He replied by saying "I'm sorry and I will speak with the workers"  TERRIBLE experience for me but Chili's had no problem accepting my money for my meal!!

I was hungry and wanted to get something to eat here....i had the barbecue ribs , with bake potatoes which was ok...nothing great ..  .the area is a little sketchy....service was decent.....probably not coming back here ever again.

Updated review: this chilis is not great. Nowadays I always order to-go because the service is getting worse and worse and no on takes pride in the food. It tends to be sloppy and luke-warm. I just can't stay away because I absolutely love Chili's. What can you do?
As far as Chili's go, this is a decent location. The staff is friendly and the drinks are ok. The food is typical Chili's food.

Worst managed restaurant period.  To start there was a wait even though the restaurant was only maybe 2/3 filled.  Not enough wait staff apparently...how does a restaurant chain like Chilis management not have enough staff?  It's not there first rodeo! Extremely long wait for our order, probably 40-45 minutes.  And then only 2 of 5 orders came out. Our Waiter Al was a nice guy, tried his best but man Chili's HQ needs to get down here and fix this place up. Clearly the employees are not properly trained.  Our waiter kept asking us who brought out the incorrect orders; asked us what is in our order that they didnt bring out; asked several times for a new ICED tea...none came; did not try to even compensate us for the bad service and mediocre food. Just plain BAD.  My wife will not go to any Chili's due to this place and experience.  Only good news is that the food did not get anyone in my family ill. DON't DO IT!

Worst service I've ever had. Meal took forever to come out. Server blamed it on kitchen staff however other tables that were seated way after us food was served before ours. Spoke to manager but to no avail.  Tables stayed dirty with no one cleaning them. This has happened on several occasions. Won't be going back there.
Very good wings and cold draft beer.  The waitress was very friendly and helpful.  I would recommend this location to others. Keep up the good work.

Worst Chili's in  history of Chili's. I love  Chili's food and drinks. I really can't comment on either here as both times I took my family we waited over 20 minutes to be seated. No one ever even acknowledged  us and they were not 2 feet away from us. The 1st time there wasn't even more than 20 customers there.  So both  times we left without ever so much as a look in our direction  . And EVERY single employee has the "I hate my job" look on their face. So go find something else, seriously.

I went here for dinner the other night with my family and the service was good, but the issue i had was with my food. I go to chili's a lot and for the most time i order the same thing. I waited a good amount of time for my food, My husbands food came out hot and so did my daughters pizzas but for some weird reason my food was warm some cold. Fries didn't taste fresh at all and the rest of my food wasn't that great either.

Went here last night and ordered Texas cheese fries as my appetizer, and the classic bacon burger as my entree. The fries tasted old and very dry on both of my plates. The burger was great though. Maybe they were a little under-staffed last night but the service was just a tad too slow. Took 20 minutes for me to get my water, another 20 to get my appetizer, and another 20 to get my burger.

Service is incredibly slow at this location. Doesn't matter what time you go, you end up with a ghost waiter that keeps disappearing. The food is mediocre. Most of the time it is barely warm and you will wait a while for a refill on your drink.  I will say the wait staff is normally very nice when you can catch them. The restaurant is dirty though.

I have visited this establishment a few times, but today after ordering a glass of wine and having to ask the manager, who just so happened to be at the register, for a clean wine glass, i decided to write a comment. The bar isnt packed but the bar tender gave me 2 dirty glasses and i find it hard to believe that she didn't notice how filthy they were. Thanks to the manager, I was able to get a clean glass for my wine after a long week. Hopefully he can get a better staff to boost and increase quality service.  So my experience wasnt all bad.......

Came here for dinner and drinks after work since it was nearby. Although our waitress was friendly, the service was extremely slow (there were only few other tables occupied). When we were getting ready to pay, the credit card kiosk wasn't working, and we needed our waitress's assistance. We waited about 30 minutes for her to come by, but she never did.

Very poor service.  Sat and waited for 15 minutes until we were able to flag a server.   Asked for water and tea and server had forgotten about it.  Brought out starters 15 minutes later without any utensils.  Came at 12:40 for lunch and it's 1:48 and he just brought out our lunch order.

Worst service ever! We came for a birthday dinner for 2 brothers and an uncle. We had already ordered and didn't get our food until almost an hour later. It was ok since we had a big part. What was not ok is that the few of us that ordered last got our food first and my family members that orders first got their food last. Our waitress was nowhere to be found so I went to the bar to get a water and the bar tender grabbed a cup that someone had used and quickly rinsed it out. The only reason we came to this location is because of the convenience, but it is NOT WORTH IT any more. Will not be coming to this location again. On another note I didn't want to put any rating and leave the stars on zero, but yelp wouldn't let me.
This food here is good and yummy and ok service , I like the steaks and the drinks are strong,.. Also if you don't drink,.. The pink lemonade is awesome

I really really HATE to give bad reviews but this location has really gone downhill.  The customer service is horrible!!! I live close to here and use to come here regularly with my mom and sister. We would always sit at the bar and knew most of the people here.  I haven't been here in at least 6 months because of the last bad experience. I thought if I ordered something to go tonight it would be ok because it was a simple order. The website said it would take 30 minutes for my order but I decided to go up there after 15 minutes since it was just soup and salad.  I get up to the counter and the employee pulled up my order and told me my total. She goes into the kitchen and when she comes back she tells me they are out of the soup I ordered. Thats not a big deal but it would have been nice to get that information before I drove up there. I asked if they normally call to let people know that the item they ordered is not available. Instead of just apologizing or trying to correct it she blames it on someone else taking the last of the soup. I decide to order something else because I was already there then I sit and wait for my order. I pay for my food and she goes into the kitchen. She came back and said they wanted to know if I wanted them to make some more soup. I told her no because I ordered paid for my food. They are other people coming in to pick up their orders and I notice that they all recieve subpar customer service. When she hands me my food I say thank you. She doesnt even look up and walks in the kitchen. I glanced at my food before leaving just to make sure it was what I ordered. When I get home I realize my food is drowning in sauce. It was really ridiculous. It was so much that I couldn't enjoy it and ended up throwing it away. I guess I ended up getting soup in the end. While I appreciate them offering to make the original fiod I ordered they really need to have some additional training. I will NOT be returning to this location again.

This has definitely been one of the worst experiences ever, second time visiting this location it was horrible, for started it took 15 mins for the bartender to acknowledge me, and an additional 15 mins to get my drink, my appetizer took about 30 mins and my food was extremely undercooked even my chicken strips spoke with manager and she got defensive and told me that my burger was chilis version of medium well , which clearly was MEDIUM , re made my food and it was burnt almost like they chef did it intentionally , my chicken strips were so over cooked and chewy and the beef for the sliders was burnt hh

My roommate and I tried to go here recently. We walked in and waited for almost ten minutes for someone to seat us or at least acknowledge the fact we existed. It wasn't busy at all and we were standing in plain sight of the bartender and multiple waitresses. We were completely ignored and just gave up and left. We decided if they couldn't even be bothered to say hello that we didn't want to know how bad the rest of the service would be. I only give it one star because Yelp won't let me give zero.

Horrible Costomer service. Restaurant was was completely trashed with food & napkins on the floor & none of the tables were cleaned off.. we also had to wait 10 mins to be waited to be seated by a god awful host. This is by far the worst Chiles I have ever been to. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone unless you want the worst Costomer service.

Terrible.  After reading all the other bad reviews we still decided to come.  From the moment we walked in, the restaurant was completely trashed.  We counted 6 tables just that we could see, not cleaned, trash on the floor- complete filth.  We waited approx 5 minutes, nobody to be seen, finally someone comes up and doesn't say hi, how are you or even go to hell, just Give me a minute.  Really? She walks to an empty table to fix the blinds.  It's 7:45 at night, the blinds can wait.  She comes back again and walks away.  We ended up walking out.  What kind of management runs this restaurant?  Chili's really needs to look at who they are hiring as it's hurting their business.  I will not come back.  First impressions are everything.  Makes you wonder what does the kitchen look like?
Worst customer service. There's a always a long wait to get your order when the restaurant is empty. If I could give it a negative star I would.
A hot, nasty, unorganized, and dirty mess. The place is not clean at all. I didn't even finish my food because I was so disgusted.

Typical Chilis, service here was good. Although our server forgot about 3 times who was drinking sweet and I sweet tea. Everyone's was mixed up so it was pretty funny. I didn't eat because I am so burnt out on Chili's. My husband had the fajitas, and our partners ordered Cheeseburger, Cajun Chicken Pasta, and Trio Basket of appetizers. They didn't complain and ate almost all their food so I would assume everything was fine.

Jacob, the host, was the MVP of our night. He's the only reason I'm giving a single star at all. We waited twenty minutes for the waiter to get our orders, and another twenty for the food to arrive. One of the orders was messed up. After fifteen minutes of watching the mail waiters skirt around us, a lady waitress took the food back for correction. Thirty minutes later, the salad had still not arrived. It's a freaking salad! Why does it take 30 minutes to make?!?! Jacob, the MVP, came to our aid, got the salad, provided the dressing that was missing. While Jacob was getting the dressing, our actual waiter, who we hadn't seen this entire time, came by and picked up all of the silverware. So, they couldn't eat the salad. Once Jacob came back with the dressing, he went and got silverware. We tipped him directly, he was the only competent reliable individual in this entire masquerade of a restaurant. When we got here, there was a family behind us. It's been over an hour since they left and their dirty dishes are still on the table. The cherry on top of the experience was the skillet cookie. Surprise! They're out of spoons and we have to use forks. Which, I know, first world problems. That doesn't bother me, it's the fact that these dishes are sitting in the open air not being cleaned and it's impacting the service to its customers. I felt like I went out to eat at a Frat house. I do not recommend this location to anyone.

I really have a lot of words about my experience at Chili's, but I'll keep it brief. We went there for a birthday gathering and they had to separate the group to avoid all of us being on one check. Next we placed an order (bacon burger and chicken pasta), and it took over an hour for them to bring the order out. We actually had to tell management to cancel the order because it was taking too long. Next the manager and waitress kept avoiding coming around our table because they knew they messed up. Everyone in the party, even people that arrived after us, end up eating and we were still waiting. I will never return to this location. Customer service is a mess/ghetto. Management is horrible. Do better Chili's.

The only reason I wanted to go was to get rid of a gift card and to get the $10.99 fajitas. My fajitas were well done which was quite a disappointment. The rice was bland and the beans lacked flavor. The tortillas were okay but after eating one I did not go back to them. The margarita was weak but flavorful.  I've come to expect Chili's to be a disappointment and it held up to that standard.

I have never had a bad experience at this location. Tasha the bartender is the greatest! I enjoy the atmosphere and the fact that they have a Evening regular crowd. The team of managers are really working to improve service.
